Tyrode_Standard.description: Tyrode's solution is a simple physiological buffer solution that mimics the ionic concentrations of interstitial fluid. It is one of the most basic extracellular solutions used in physiological experiments, containing only a few essential ions and a buffer system to maintain pH.

Tyrode_HK⁺_10_mM.description: A variation of the standard Tyrode's solution with a higher concentration of potassium. Compared to the standard 4 mM potassium, this extracellular solution induces a depolarization of about 25 mV in a membrane permeable only to K<sup>+</sup> with intracellular [K<sup>+</sup>]=150 mM (from -96.8 mV to -72.3 mV).

Tyrode_HK⁺_40_mM.description: A variation of the standard Tyrode's solution with a higher concentration of potassium. Compared to the standard 4 mM potassium, this extracellular solution induces a depolarization of about 62 mV in a membrane permeable only to K<sup>+</sup> with intracellular [K<sup>+</sup>]=150 mM (from -96.8 mV to -35.3 mV).

Tyrode_HK⁺_70_mM.description: A variation of the standard Tyrode's solution with a higher concentration of potassium. Compared to the standard 4 mM potassium, this extracellular solution induces a depolarization of about 76 mV in a membrane permeable only to K<sup>+</sup> with intracellular [K<sup>+</sup>]=150 mM (from -96.8 mV to -20.3 mV).

Tyrode_HK⁺_150_mM.description: A variation of the standard Tyrode's solution with maximal potassium concentration. Compared to the standard 4 mM potassium, this extracellular solution induces a strong depolarization of about 97 mV, which neutralizes the electrical potential across a membrane permeable only to K<sup>+</sup> with intracellular [K<sup>+</sup>]=150 mM (from -96.8 mV to 0 mV).

Tyrode_0_Ca²⁺_-_0.5_EGTA.description: A variation of the standard Tyrode's solution without calcium.

SIKA_0_EGTA.description: Standard intracellular solution with potassium and contaminating calcium.

SIKA_1.1_EGTA.description: Standard intracellular solution with potassium and 0 mM calcium.
